message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SE 

This paper discusses the use of data mining techniques to detect power theft in smart grids. It involves the analysis of electricity consumption patterns of consumers, which falls under the category of machine learning and data mining (cs.AI, cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) in smart grids, which is related to the security and privacy of communication networks (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper proposes a computational method for power theft detection, which involves the use of algorithms and software engineering techniques (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the application of the proposed method in the context of power network operation and management, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SI).
